summary: The Security Council, recalling its resolutions 1970 (2011) and 2292 (2016) on the arms embargo on Libya, and its primary responsibility for maintaining international peace and security, reaffirms its determination to combat terrorism. Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter, it decides to extend the authorizations in resolution 2292 for 12 months. The Secretary-General is requested to report on implementation within 11 months. The Council will remain actively seized of the matter.
